intro: Agalinis divaricata, commonly known as the slender bluetail, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Acanthaceae family and typically grows in moist, sandy soils along stream banks and wetlands. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that are often pink or purple, which attract various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. It is a herbaceous perennial that thrives in partial to full sun and is often found in disturbed or open habitats. Due to its ecological importance and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
